alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 5:19PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Shelby County through 545 PM CDT... At 519 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Windsor, or 11 miles east of Shelbyville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Shelby County, including the following locations... Strasburg, Sigel and Trowbridge. This includes Interstate 57 between mile markers 169 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
